page.title: 01CRAWLEY DOWN & TURNERS HILL
page.content: Crawley Down and Turners Hill lie respectively 30 and 32 miles south of {London,}4 miles west of{East Grinstead and 5 miles east of{Crawley. Crawley Down was a{common}which was enclosed in the 19th. century. In the 1970's Crawley Down more than doubled in size when old{brickworking}land was released for housing. To the north, by the{A.264}road, lies{Snowhill,}a settlement, also once a common. To the north east of the village lies an area called{Furnace Wood,}because of the {iron workings}which were once there. Turners Hill began as a settlement built around a crossroads as early as the 15th. century.{Rowfant}is a hamlet which grew up around{Rowfant House,}a mile west of the two main villages. To the south west lies{Worth Abbey;}once part of the{Paddockhurst Estate,}which owns hundreds of acres in the area.
